meanings.definition: To make (a problem, injury, or offense) worse or more serious.
meanings.sent1: Not following the doctor's advice can aggravate your injury.
meanings.sent2: Please don't aggravate the situation by arguing with others.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fix the computer yourself might aggravate the problem even more.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the leak in the roof will only aggravate the situation.
meanings.sent5: His constant complaints only serve to aggravate the issue further.

meanings.sent1: The loud music from the party next door started to aggravate me.
meanings.sent2: Her constant tapping on the desk began to aggravate her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy seemed to aggravate the old cat on purpose.
meanings.sent4: The buzzing sound of the mosquito near my ear aggravates me.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive beeping of the alarm clock can aggravate anyone's morning mood.
